messages.body: I would like to talk with Rashid Ashraf directly
OK, so I’ve summarized the conversation for both of you, and asked Rashid Ashraf to join. It shouldn’t take so long.

Hi there,
This is Rashid thank you for reaching out 
How can I assist you today?

I own a creative print company. Right now our workflow looks like this:

Orders come in through WordPress/WooCommerce.

We onboard clients into Basecamp for communication and project tracking.

For design proofs and approvals, we’ve been using WeTransfer’s Review & Portals to upload designs and let clients comment or approve.

The issue: WeTransfer is shutting down that platform, and most alternatives I’ve found are either overpriced or missing the features we need.

What I’m looking for is a custom client proofing/approval system where:

I can upload multiple design items (for example: tent canopy, table cover, feather flags, walls, etc.) under one project link.

Clients click the link (no account/login required) and can:

View all items in the package.

Pinpoint comments/annotations on each item.

Approve or request changes on each item.

Each item should support versions (V1, V2, etc.) with version history and comparison.

Once all items are approved, the full project/package can be marked approved.

Ideally, it also generates an approval report with timestamps and client names.

This doesn’t need to replace Basecamp or WooCommerce — I just need it to sit alongside and give me a shareable review link for clients, the same way WeTransfer worked.

Summary: 
- Ability for the admin to create a "project" and attach multiple design items.
- Generate Client review link (no login required).
- Upload multiple assets.
- Clients can click/tap on an asset and drop comments.
- Approve / Request changes per item.
- Support versions for each item (V1, V2, V3, etc.).
- Admin uploads a new version.
- Clients can compare versions, and previous versions are kept.
- Once all items are approved, the admin or client may mark the whole project as approved.
- The system detects the “all items approved” state.
- Notifications sent to our team with every comment and or approval.
- Admin backend.
- Shareable approval report.
On request, or automatically when the project is approved, generate a report (PDF or downloadable page) listing all approvals, comments, timestamps, and client names.
Thanks for providing details allow me 3-4 mins to read
